name: Biliary Dyskinesia
chief_complaint: Recurrent right upper quadrant pain after eating, especially fatty foods
physical_findings: Mild tenderness in right upper quadrant
treatment: Cholecystectomy (if severe and unresponsive to conservative measures)
prognosis: Good with dietary modifications; excellent after cholecystectomy if indicated
description: A functional gallbladder disorder characterized by impaired gallbladder emptying without gallstones. Diagnosed via HIDA scan showing reduced ejection fraction (<35%). Often confused with biliary colic but lacks structural abnormalities.
